metadata.title: Journal Pre-proof Laboratory Biomarkers Predicting COVID-19 Severity in the Emergency Room

body_text.text: Arch Med Res E20_698 2 March 11 th 2020 and is now a world public health crisis. The World perception changing dramatically.

body_text.text: It is now known that SARS-CoV-2 triggers a heterogeneous clinical manifestation, encompassing a wide range of clinical spectrum, going from an asymptomatic course to an acute respiratory distress syndrome with a high risk of death (1) (2) (3) .

body_text.text: Lombardy is now considered the Italian Region that major hit by COVID-19, with 78105 cases out of 211938 throughout Italy at May 4 rd 2020. The first Italian autochthonous patient was recorded in Codogno, Lombardy, on February 18 th 2020, 25 km far from Crema.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: In the following days, the Maggiore Hospital Emergency Unit was invaded by suspected COVID-19 patients. In the first time at the emergency room, a positive Real-Time PCR (RT-PCR) test for SARS-CoV-2 after nasopharyngeal swab was officially considered the hallmark for COVID-19 diagnosis.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: However, this technique has affected by several drawbacks. Pre-analytical troubles, suboptimal sensitivity, long production time results and other intrinsic methodological features affect RT-PCR.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: Using CT-scan as gold standard for the diagnosis of interstitial pneumonia, we recently calculated the diagnostic accuracy of the nasopharyngeal swab in entire study population of 539 patients, with good sensitivity (80%) but low specificity (45%) (4).
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: It's a logic deduction that the method cannot be yet considered a rapid and specific tool that can be used for a triage in Emergency room.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: It is now recognized that even after an apparently benign initial stage, during which the virus replicates and first symptoms appear, a second more aggressive course due to hyperinflammation can intervene in some patients, with a need of urgent hospitalization or intensive care.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: We preliminarily observed that several laboratory tests have been shown as characteristically altered in COVID-19 and we have been proposed as rapid and sensitive alternatives in identifying likely Arch Med Res E20_698 3 COVID-19 cases. In our paper simple baseline laboratory biomarkers have been clearly linked to clinical feature (4).
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: Our laboratory exams at admission showed white blood cell count below 10x10 9 /L in 82% of patients, neutrophil count below 10x10 9 /L in 83.4%, and lymphocyte count below 1x10 9 /L in 55.6%.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: Also, C-reactive protein (CRP), aspartate aminotransferase and lactate dehydrogenase values were elevated in most patients, particularly among those with worst clinical picture and outcome (4).
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: The neutrophil/lymphocyte ratio (N/L ratio) was also higher in patients with a more severe disease, as previously reported (5) .
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: As one of the most distinctive acute phase reactants, the short-pentraxin CRP increases rapidly after the onset of inflammation. COVID-19 Pulmonary disease with inflammatory features usually raise serum CRP level in response to inflammatory cytokines, such as IL-6, IL-1 or TNF-α (6). We found by ROC curve analysis that a CRP>7 mg/dL can identify subjects with a severe disease (4).
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: Similarly, Oxygen saturation (SaO2) was found as another candidate marker of progressive severity.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: The fact that it was so tightly associated to hospitalization or even death in our model is unsurprising, because a low SaO2 is one of the main criteria for the definition of a severe case. Despite SaO2 is an indirect way to monitor arterial oxygen pressure (PaO2) and it may lead to blood oxygen content overestimation in the case of anemia , our data enforce the notion that in most cases the commonly used cutoff (93%) is an important tool to evaluate the severity of COVID-19 (1).
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: Because all the alterations we described can be linked to the inflammation pathway, our findings also support the need of expanding research on the dysregulation of the first steps of innate immunity, possibly involving more precocious markers of the pentraxins family, different from CRP.
body_text.section: Infection by the novel Coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) has been declared pandemic by the WHO on

body_text.text: In conclusion we propose that a few parameters, such Lymphocytes count, L/N ratio, SaO2 and CRP serum level can be used to assess the severity of COVID-19 in emergency room.
